meanings.definition: The doctrine that the substance of the bread and wine coexists with the body and blood of Christ in the Eucharist.
meanings.sent1: During the church service, the priest explained the concept of consubstantiation to the congregation.
meanings.sent2: Many Christians adhere to the idea of consubstantiation during communion.
meanings.sent3: The idea of consubstantiation made Sarah chuckle as she imagined bread and wine having a secret meeting.
meanings.sent4: In the ritual, consubstantiation transforms ordinary elements into something sacred.
meanings.sent5: The image of consubstantiation stayed with Mark long after the church service ended.

meanings.definition: The belief that two substances are united in one substance.
meanings.sent1: The philosopher's theory of consubstantiation fascinated his students.
meanings.sent2: The alchemist sought to achieve consubstantiation of different elements in his experiments.
meanings.sent3: The idea of consubstantiation in cooking led to a unique fusion of flavors in the dish.
meanings.sent4: Their friendship was a perfect example of consubstantiation, where two distinct personalities blended seamlessly.
meanings.sent5: The artist's painting depicted the beauty of consubstantiation between light and shadow.
